intro: Tricera flaviramea, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
